text: <@U01BDQN1PNW> You noted you do not feel comfortable creating sites using React JS, and that you feel limited. Would love to hear your feedback. First Iâ€™d like to know have you read <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/js-frameworks|our article on using frameworks on HubSpot?> and tried our <https://github.com/HubSpot/cms-react-boilerplate|React boilerplate>? What did you like/not like? we want to improve it to make it a smoother experience.

Hi everyone! Sorry if this is the wrong place to ask. I don't have much experience with frameworks in hs but I just want to know if this is possible. I have a client that has a ReactJS / Gatsby blog template and are looking to implement it in HubSpot, is this possible?

<@U019U0704BG> are they looking to move their blog to HubSpot, or use HubSpot as a data source for their blog?

If the latter, I'd suggest taking a look at this Gatsby plugin, which makes HubSpot blogs available to Gatsby's GraphQL service: <https://www.gatsbyjs.com/plugins/gatsby-source-HubSpot/>
<@U26BLKGE4> thanks so much for your response! They are looking to move their blog into HubSpot.

hi everyone! I'm building a custom module with cms-react-bolierplate and I've added a sign in button that I want to have redirect to a sign in page on my website when clicked. I keep running into `Refused to display '<http://MyMebsitesSignInPage.com>' in a frame because it set 'X-Frame-Options' to 'sameorigin'.` I have links to my sites on another section of my module that work perfectly well so I'm confused as to why I'm getting this. Has anyone run into this before?
